result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas James Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
All financial obligations are placed on a payment plan of $50 per month beginning 6/8/17.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.

Attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann in court for Defendant Nickolas James Bell. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nickolas James Bell appeared by phone means. Hearing for BBFF. Def comments on failure to appr. Ct comments 12/18 failed to appr in court, warrant outstanding since then-canceled. DA no comment, expected that this was set for a ff hearing is Kressels case. Ct Reinstates SB. Set up contested hearing for DEJ. DAP. If state wants judgment for BBFF at that time court will hear at that time too. Ct advises def that he has a commitment today and will not cancel today. Def comments can pay $100, Ct will probably cancel for that amount.  Status conference scheduled for February 23, 2018 at 11:00 am.
